Package io.github.humbleui.skija

Enum ColorType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ColorType>
      • io.github.humbleui.skija.ColorType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ColorType>
    public enum ColorType
extends java.lang.Enum<ColorType>
    Describes how pixel bits encode color. A pixel may be an alpha mask, a grayscale, RGB, or ARGB.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant Description
      A16_FLOAT
      Pixel with a half float for alpha
      A16_UNORM
      Pixel with a little endian uint16_t for alpha
      ALPHA_8
      Pixel with alpha in 8-bit byte
      ARGB_4444
      Pixel with 4 bits for alpha, red, green, blue; in 16-bit word
      BGR_101010X
      Pixel with 10 bits each for blue, green, red; in 32-bit word
      BGRA_1010102
      10 bits for blue, green, red; 2 bits for alpha; in 32-bit word
      BGRA_8888
      Pixel with 8 bits for blue, green, red, alpha; in 32-bit word
      GRAY_8
      Pixel with grayscale level in 8-bit byte
      R16G16_FLOAT
      Pixel with a half float for red and green
      R16G16_UNORM
      Pixel with a little endian uint16_t for red and green
      R16G16B16A16_UNORM
      Pixel with a little endian uint16_t for red, green, blue, and alpha
      R8G8_UNORM
      Pixel with a uint8_t for red and green
      RGB_101010X
      Pixel with 10 bits each for red, green, blue; in 32-bit word
      RGB_565
      Pixel with 5 bits red, 6 bits green, 5 bits blue, in 16-bit word
      RGB_888X
      Pixel with 8 bits each for red, green, blue; in 32-bit word
      RGBA_1010102
      10 bits for red, green, blue; 2 bits for alpha; in 32-bit word
      RGBA_8888
      Pixel with 8 bits for red, green, blue, alpha; in 32-bit word
      RGBA_F16
      Pixel with half floats for red, green, blue, alpha; in 64-bit word
      RGBA_F16NORM
      Pixel with half floats in [0,1] for red, green, blue, alpha; in 64-bit word
      RGBA_F32
      Pixel using C float for red, green, blue, alpha; in 128-bit word
      UNKNOWN
      Uninitialized

      • getBytesPerPixel

        public int getBytesPerPixel()
        Returns the number of bytes required to store a pixel, including unused padding. Returns zero for UNKNOWN.
        Returns:
        bytes per pixel

      • getShiftPerPixel

        public int getShiftPerPixel()

      • isAlwaysOpaque

        public boolean isAlwaysOpaque()
        Returns true if ColorType always decodes alpha to 1.0, making the pixel fully opaque. If true, ColorType does not reserve bits to encode alpha.
        Returns:
        true if alpha is always set to 1.0

      • validateAlphaType

        @Nullable
public @Nullable ColorAlphaType validateAlphaType​(ColorAlphaType alphaType)

        Returns a valid ColorAlphaType for colorType. If there is more than one valid canonical ColorAlphaType, set to alphaType, if valid.

        Returns null only if alphaType is ColorAlphaType.UNKNOWN, color type is not UNKNOWN, and ColorType is not always opaque.

        Returns:
        ColorAlphaType if can be associated with colorType
